Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that the client application processes incorrectly formatted XML
Test Steps: Load an incorrectly formatted XML instance into the client application, verify that errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check  that the client application shall process file with incorrect entries
Test Steps: Load an XML instance with incorrect entries into the client application, verify that errors or warnings are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that the client application shall process file with invalid data types
Test Steps: Load an XML instance with invalid data types into the client application, verify that errors or warnings are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that the client application shall process incorrect data units.
Test Steps: Load an XML instance with invalid data units into the client application, verify that errors or warnings are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check client application correctly process invalid data ranges
Test Steps: Load an XML instance with invalid data ranges into the client application, verify that errors or warnings are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check  that client application correctly processes links that point to invalid entries.
Test Steps: Load an XML instance with links to undefined objects into the client application, verify that errors or warnings are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that the client appication shall process file with correct date representations
Test Steps: Load an XML instance with correct date representations and verify no errors are generated

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that client appication correctly processes invalid date representations
Test Steps: Load an XML instance with invalid date representations and verify that errors or warnings are generated

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check client ability to handle multiple meter readings (different reading types, if possible?)
Check client ability to handle missing intervals
Check client ability to handle default (ReadingType) intervalLength, with subsequent IntervalReadings having only value
Check that the client application processes correctly formatted XML as described by the current approved version of espi.xsd
Test Steps: Load a correctly formatted XML instance into the client application, verify that the data is accessible and no errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check  that the client application shall process file with correct entries
Test Steps: Load a correctly formatted XML instance with correct entries into the client application, verify that the data is accessible and no errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that the client application shall process file with valid data types
Test Steps: Load a correctly formatted XML instance with valid data types into the client application, verify that the data is accessible and no errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that the client application shall process correct data units.
Test Steps: Load a correctly formatted XML instance with correct data units into the client application, verify that the data is accessible and no errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that client application correctly process data ranges
Test Steps: Load a correctly formatted XML instance into the client application, verify that the data is accessible, data ranges are correct, and no errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that client application correctly processes links that point to contained entries.
Test Steps: Load a fully valid XML instance into the client application, verify that the data is accessible, associations between objects are correct, and no errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check that client application correctly process timestamps
Test Steps: Load a fully valid XML instance into the client application, verify that the data is accessible, timestamps are correct, and no errors are generated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check client ability to handle multiple usage points
Verify ability to authorize and configure a third party
Test Steps: 1. Third party provides application information to data custodian, either manually or using

Test Name: Verify Data Custodian Purchase of Standard
Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify the implementer has purchased the NAESB ESPI standard.
Test Steps:
1.  Obtain the current "NAESB Copyright Policy and Companies with Access to NAESB Standard at http://www.naesb.org/pdf2/copyright.pdf. 
2.  Locate implementer's name on the North American Energy Standards Board's (NAESB) "Companies with Access to NAESB Standards" report.
3.  Verify the "Retail Version(s)" column of the report's "Standard Products" section contains evidence of implementer having purchased the NAESB ESPI 1.0 Standard [column includes  the "2.0" version | "Final Action (ESPI): 2011 Retail API 8c/R10008" | "REQ.21 (ESPI"].
Success Criteria: Implementer's purchase of NAESB ESPI Standard is witnessed and verified using the NAESB "Companies with Access to NAESB Standards" report by tester.
Failure Criteria: Implementer's name does not appear on the NAESB "Companies with Access to NAESB Standards" report or if it appears the "Retail Version(s)" column of the "Standard Products" section does not indicate the implementer has purchased the NAESB ESPI Standard.

Test Name: Verify Third Party Purchase of Standard
Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify the implementer has purchased the NAESB ESPI standard.
Test Steps:
1.  Locate implementer's name on the North American Energy Standards Board's (NAESB) "Companies with Access to NAESB Standards" report.
2.  Verify the "Retail Version(s)" column of the report's "Standard Products" section contains evidence of implementer having purchased the NAESB ESPI 1.0 Standard [column contains "1.0-2.0" | "Final Action (ESPI): 2011 Retail API 8c/R10008" | "REQ.21 (ESPI"]
Success Criteria: Implementer's purchase of NAESB ESPI Standard is witnessed and verified using the NAESB "Companies with Access to NAESB Standards" report by tester.
Failure Criteria: Implementer's name does not appear on the NAESB "Companies with Access to NAESB Standards" report or if it appears the "Retail Version(s)" column of the "Standard Products" section does not indicate the implementer has purchased the NAESB ESPI Standard.

Verify by analysis that ESPI timestamps (based on espi:TimeType) in Green Button data files are based on UTC without timezone or DST offsets.
Test Steps:
1. Log in as an eligible user.
2. Download UsagePoints and save XML Instance. Note starting date for data set should be 0:00 Local Time
3. Log out.
4. The testee will indicate the time and reference of the first IntervalBlock and first Interval.
5. Analyze the timestamps (paste into this time converter: http://www.epochconverter.com/) and verify that the start time of the first IntervalBlock is a UTC for that time (for example in note 2 this would be UTC equivalent of 0:00 local time).
Success Criteria: All timestamps are based on UTC without timezone or DST offsets.

Test Name: MeterReading Interval Block/Interval Readings/ are all unique (by start time)
Test Purpose / Requirement: verify the presence of unique values

Test Name: MeterReading Interval Blocks are all unique (by start time)
Test Purpose / Requirement: verify the presence of unique values
verify the presence of temperature (Kelvin) readings
Check UUIDs remain the same over time.
Test Steps:
1.  Log in as an eligible user.
2.  Select at least one UsagePoint associated with the account.
3.  Download UsagePoints and save XML Instance.
4.  Log out.
5.  Log into same account.
6.  Select same UsagePoints that were selected in the first enquiry.
7.  Download UsagePoints and save XML Instance.
8.  Compare saved XML Instance files.
9.  All UUIDs in the two XML Instance files should be the same.
Success Criteria: All UsagePoint  UUIDs remain the same over time.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify that schema validation and all automated test succeed
Initial Conditions: File has been downloaded
Test Steps:
1. Go to URL for automated test using FF web browser http://www.greenbuttondata.org/greentest.aspx 
2. Select the data content analysis subset of FBs according to the PICS
3. Check the box for download test results (under 4) Enable download of test results after test execution)
4. Run the automated test by dropping the downloaded file on the designated place (under 5_Drop File Here to Upload)
5. Download results file
6. Insert the test report below by using insert/object/text from file  and select downloaded test results (between ======= lines)
==========================
==========================
Success Criteria: All tests successful
Failure Criteria: Validation produces one or more errors

Test Purpose / Requirement: Check atom timestamps (based on atom:dateTimeType) are encoded as Universal Coordinated Time (UTC)
Test Steps:
1. The testee indicates the time at which the feed.updated timestamp was created (could be when it was downloaded)
2.  Verify that the value of this timestamp is referenced to Zulu time (agrees with the universal time represented by the time given in 1)
3. Verify that they end in Z for Zulu
Success Criteria: All atom timestamps are based on UTC without timezone or DST offsets.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify GET behavior for feeds

<ReadingType/>

<ReadingType/>

Test Name: [? Ensure that quality flags are applied as appropriate?] GB Granular Data
Test Purpose / Requirement: Export should not summarize usage data beyond what was captured by the meter
Test Steps:
1.  Log in as an eligible user.
2.  Download UsagePoints and save XML Instance. 
3.  Log out.
4.  Inspect XML Instance file to confirm file contains granular interval data consistent with meter capability (i.e. 15-minute meter data is NOT reported as hourly meter data).
Success Criteria: XML file contains interval data consistent with the AMI meter's capability.
Comments: ??? Not sure how to do this test.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export shall provide total usage by commodity type
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established. Account must have at least two commodities represented -- suggest gas and electric.
Test Steps:
1.  Download data.
2.  Inspect file for presence of ElectricPowerUsageSummary entries.
Success Criteria: Verify that there is one ElectricPowerUsageSummary per UsagePoint in the data file.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export shall include all usage data available, including actual or estimates data (whichever available)
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1.  Construct data set that contains estimated and actual data elements.
2.  Specify dates containing missed / estimated reads, and verify that estimated data exists and is marked as such within the IntervalReadings.
3.  Download data.
Success Criteria: Verify that the ReadingType defaultQuality is populated with either Raw or Actual and that some of the intervals have quality tags that signify the opposite.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export should denote estimated usage data
Initial Conditions: Note: As discussed need a summary level statement. Stating there are actual and estimated data in the data download.  Dont need to denote at each interval level.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export should provide billing and/or pricing data available
Initial Conditions:
Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Note: Current version for this year this will not be provided
Success Criteria: Verify that billLastPeriod and costAdditionalLastPeriod are populated.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export should not provide or use Personally Identifiable Information (PII)
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1. Log into test account.
2. Download the Green Button file and accept the recommended file name
3. Verify that the filename has no PII
4. Inspect the file contents and verify that no PII is present -- look at atom titles and uris
Success Criteria:
Verify that no non-standard tags appear in the data file. 
Inspect the extension fields for illegitimate data.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export should not encrypt the data
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1.  Download data.
2.  Validate against the schema.
Success Criteria: Verify that file validates (therefore not encrypted and contains only shema valid text).
Comments: HTTPS should be used to encrypt the data in transit, but saved file should not require any further decryption.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export should use a standard file naming process and allow customer to change the file name when saving
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1.  Begin the download data.
2.  During the file "SaveAs" dialog, change the file name to "test.xml".
3. Verify that the file was saved as test.xml.
Success Criteria: Verify that the file saved is "Test.xml"

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export shall use ESPI file format
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1.  Download data.
2.  Validate against the schema.
Success Criteria: Verify that file validates (therefore not encrypted and contains only shema valid text).

Test Purpose / Requirement: Customer shall access the information based on current login to access their consumption data
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1. Log in as an eligible user and verify that applicable information is accessible by Green Button Icon on access screen.
2. Access the download function through accessing the Green Button Icon
3. Verify that unique information about the logged in user is presented prior to download.
4. Use the key combination alt + print screen and paste image here (between the ==== lines)  Note if appropriate erase or otherwise cover up personal data with Paint Program"):
====================================
====================================
Success Criteria:
After login, the user is presented with Green Button Graphic.

Pressing the Green Button Graphic provides the download or dialog to retrieve Green Button Data file.
Failure Criteria:
No Green Button Graphic or
non-acting Green Button Graphic or data not retrievable via page instructions.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export shall have a common filename convention
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1.  Begin the download data.
2.  Inspect the file "SaveAs" for the default file name format.
3.  Inspect the filename for these features:
    1) Company name e.g. SDGE
    2) Type of service e.g. Electric, Gas, or Water
    3) Type of data e.g. Interval Data, Usage
    4) Timeframe of the data being downloaded start time and end time.
Filename Example: SDGE_Electric_60_Minute_01-11-2012_02-10-2013.XML
4. Paste the filename between the ==== lines
====================================
====================================
Success Criteria: Verify that the file name provided meets the defined format.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Common Green Button icon graphics shall be displayed
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to the Download My Data web page and verify that green button Download My Data is available
2. Verify that a Green Button Download My Data graphic is displayed on this page.
Success Criteria: Verify that page has Green Button "Download My Data" graphic

Test Purpose / Requirement: Customer should not be authenticated or authorized as part of the download process
Initial Conditions:
Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Note: Customer will be authenticated as part of current login to access their data.
Test Steps:
1. Log out and verify that green button is not accessible
2. Log in as an eligible user and verify that green button is accessible
3. Proceed to follow the instruction to download Green Button Data file
4. Verify that download does not require re-authentication
Success Criteria: No second log in is required to access Green Button Data
Failure Criteria: Second log in required during navigation to Green Button Data download.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Customer shall only have access to usage data from points associated with their customer accounts.
Initial Conditions:
Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established. This account should have more than one UsagePoint.

A second test account is established with at least one Usage Point.
Test Steps: Testee asserts that a Usage Point and its associated Green Button Data is associated with a customer account and only available to the RetailCustomer while the account is active.
Success Criteria: User should not be able to download data for Usage Point(s) before they became the owner, or for which they are not currently the owner
Comments: May want to add requirement that warnings are shown

Test Purpose / Requirement: Customers shall have the ability to download usage data using a Green Button
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1. Log in as an eligible user and verify that green button functionality is accessible
2. Select web page in browser so graphic is showing
3. Use the key combination alt + print screen and paste image here (between two lines of ===):
====================================================
====================================================
4. Click on Green Button Graphic should convey the user to a download process dialog
Success Criteria:
After login, the user is presented with Green Button Graphic.

Pressing the Green Button Graphic provides the download or dialog to retrieve Green Button Data file.
Failure Criteria:
No Green Button Graphic or
non-acting Green Button Graphic

Test Purpose / Requirement: Customer shall be able to access at least 13 months of data, limited by usage data that has been collected by the data custodian and/or access rights
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1. Use procedure from Test GB017 to attempt to download at least 13 months of data from a valid point where at least 13 months of data exist.
2. Verify that there are at least 13 months of data in the file by using the http://www.epochconverter.com/ and compare the start of the first and last IntervalBlock in the file and verify they therefore contain 13 months of data.  total duration = (last IntervalBlock start time + duration  first IntervalBlock.start) / 86400
Success Criteria: User should be able to retrieve at least 13 months if it has been acquired by the Data Custodian
Failure Criteria: Greater than 13 months of data successfully retrieved.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Customers should be able to input from and to dates
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1. Navigate to Green Button download selection page, and verify that "from" and "to" date input controls are present.
2. Download an arbitrary selection of dates
3. Verify that the GBDMD file has only data within that date range.
Success Criteria: The controls are present
Failure Criteria: The controls are not present or will not accept up to 13 month range

Test Purpose / Requirement: If the full data range selected is not available, a message should be displayed that states that the data file does not cover the entire selected period.
Test Steps:
1. Attempt to download a range of data larger than what exists.
2. Verify that a message is displayed stating the data is unavailable.
Success Criteria: A notice is displayed noting that the dataset does not contain all the requested intervals due to data availability.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Customer should be able to save export file to any location they can access from the local machine
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
After selecting the point and other inputs, verify that the save dialog allows the user to choose the save location.

Save to desktop

Save to download directory 

Save to My Documents
Success Criteria: Verify save location includes desktop, download, and My Documents directory.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export usage data shall be based on customer's meter intervals.
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1.  Download data.
2.  Inspect file for presence of IntervalBlock entry and IntervalReading.
Success Criteria: Verify there is at least one IntervalBlock entry.  Verify there is at least one IntervalReading.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Export shall group usage data by date, month and year, e.g. starting at 00 to 24 hours for each day in the month, from day 1 to end of month and then by year, demarked on a daily basis
Initial Conditions: Test or user account credentials and Green Button Access established.
Test Steps:
1.  Download data.
2.  Inspect file for presence of IntervalBlock entry and IntervalReading
Success Criteria: Verify that there are IntervalBlocks with a daily, weekly, monthly, or yearly duration

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify server provides an Authorization Endpoint per OAuth 2.0 specification [RFC6749]
Test Steps: 1. Verify server provides an OAuth 2.0 Authorization Endpoint and its URI is provided to Third Parties during registration process

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify server provides a Token Endpoint per OAuth 2.0 specification [RFC6749]
Test Steps: 1. Verify server provides an OAuth 2.0 Token Endpoint and its URI is provided to Third Parties during registration process

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify client provides a Redirection Endpoint per OAuth 2.0 specification [RFC6749]
Test Steps: 1. Verify client provides a Redirection Endpoint and its URI is provided to Data Custodian during registration process

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian provides client with Third Party Identification value per OAuth 2.0 specification [RFC6749]
Test Steps: 1. Verify Data Custodian provides client with a Third Party Identification during registration process

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian provides client with Third Party Secret value per OAuth 2.0 specification [RFC6749]
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Verify Data Custodian provides client with a Third Party Secret during registration process

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Third Party issues a validly formatted Authorization Code Request
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                   2. Verify Authorization Request is sent to the Data Custodian's Authorization Endpoint                                                                                                                                                                                3. Verify all mandatory authorization request fields appear in the query component of the authorization request using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format                                                                                                                                            4. Verify the "response_type" element value is "code"                                                                                                                            5. Verify the "client_id" element contains the Third Party ID issued to the client by the Data Custodian during the registration process                                                                                                                                                                                        6. Verify the "redirection_uri" element (if included in the authorization request) is an absolute URI and DOES NOT include a fragment component                                                                                                                                                                                                7. Verify the "scope" element is present and its values are space separated and meet the Scope Parameter Definitions defined by the OpenESPI committee                                                                                                                                                                                          8. Verify the "state" element is present in the authorization request

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects an Authorization Code Request with NO "Response Code" parameter
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749] without a "response_code" element                                                                                                                 2. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 3. Verify the error response contains a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                       4. Verify the Data Custodian does not redirect the client to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects an Authorization Code Request with NO "client_id" parameter
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749] without a "client_id" element                                                                                                            2. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"                                                                                                                                                                                                          3. Verify the error response contains a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                       4. Verify the Data Custodian does not redirect the client to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects an Authorization Code Request with NO "redirect_uri" parameter
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749] without a "redirect_uri" element                                                                                                            2. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"                                                                                                                                                                                                          3. Verify the error response contains a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                       4. Verify the Data Custodian does not redirect the client to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects an Authorization Code Request with NO "scope" parameter
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured

Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749] with NO "scope" element                                                                                                                 2. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_scope"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 3. Verify the error response contains a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                       4. Verify the Data Custodian redirects the Retail Customer (via User-Agent) to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Verify the Data Custodian redirects the Retail Customer (via User-Agent) to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Verify the error response contains a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                       4. Verify the Data Custodian does not redirect the client to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

The server issues an Authorization Code Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"                                                                                                                                                                                           3. Verify the error response contains a "state" element if the original Authorization Code Request contained a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                       4. Verify the error response contains a "state" element and the value in the error response matches thefirst  value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                       4. Verify the Data Custodian does not redirect the client to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian properly validates Retail Customer while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues a validly formatted OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                2. The server authenticates the Retail Customer (via the User Agent) which is typically performed by asking the Retail Customer to sign-on

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian proper handles a Retail Customer who fails to pass authentication testing while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues a validly formatted OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                2. The server authenticates the Retail Customer (via the User Agent) which is typically performed by asking the Retail Customer to sign-on                                                                                                                                                                                           3. The Retail Customer FAILS the Authentication Process                                                                                                      4. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Error Response with an "error" element of "access_denied"                                                                                                                                                                                                                        5. Verify the error response contains a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value sent in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                      6. Verify the Data Custodian does not redirect the client to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian properly obtains the Retail Customer's authorization for the Third Party to access their data while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues a validly formatted OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                2. The server authenticates the Retail Customer (via the User Agent) which is typically performed by asking the Retail Customer to sign-on                                                                                                                                                                                           3. The Retail Customer PASSES the Authentication Process                                                                                                                                         4. The server provides the Retail Customer the ability to authorize or deny the Third Party access to their data while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian properly processes a Retail Customer's denial to allow a Third Party to access their data while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues a validly formatted OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                2. The server authenticates the Retail Customer (via the User Agent) which is typically performed by asking the Retail Customer to sign-on                                                                                                                                                                                          3. The Retail Customer PASSES the Authentication Process                                                                                                      4. The server provides the Retail Customer the ability to authorize or deny the Third Party access to their data while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                   5. The Retail Customer denies the Third Party access to their data                                                                                                                   6. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Error Response with an "error" element of "access_denied"                                                                                                                                                                                                                          7. Verify the error response contains a "state" element if the original Authorization Code Request contained a "state" element and the value in the error response matches the value received in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                      8. Verify the Data Custodian redirects the Retail Customer (via the User-Agent) to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian properly processes a Retail Customer's authorization to allow a Third Party to access their data while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues a validly formatted OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                2. The server authenticates the Retail Customer (via the User Agent) which is typically performed by asking the Retail Customer to sign-on                                                                                                                                                                                          3. The Retail Customer PASSES the Authentication Process                                                                                                      4. The server provides the Retail Customer the ability to authorize or deny the Third Party access to their data while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                    5. The Retail Customer authorizes the Third Party access to their data                                                                                                                   6. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Response                                                                                                                                                                         7. Verify the response contains a "code" element                                                                                                            8. Verify the response contains a "state" element if the original Authorization Code Request contained a "state" element and the value in the response matches the value received in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                      9. Verify the Data Custodian redirects the Retail Customer (via the User-Agent) to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Third Party ignores any unrecognized response parameters in the Authorization Code Response [RFC6749]
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues a validly formatted OAuth 2.0 Authorization Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                2. The server authenticates the Retail Customer (via the User Agent) which is typically performed by asking the Retail Customer to sign-on                                                                                                                                                                                           3. The Retail Customer PASSES the Authentication Process                                                                                                                  4. The server provides the Retail Customer the ability to authorize or deny the Third Party access to their data  while processing a valid Authorization Code Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                          5. The Retail Customer authorizes the Third Party access to their data                                                                                                                   6. The server issues an Authorization Code Request Response with a "&gigo=GarbageInGarbageOut" response parameter                                                                                                                                                                         7. Verify the response contains a "code" element                                                                                                            8. Verify the response contains a "state" element if the original Authorization Code Request contained a "state" element and the value in the response matches the value received in the Authorization Code Request                                                                                                                                                                                      9. Verify the Data Custodian redirects the Retail Customer (via the User-Agent) to the Redirection Endpoint specified in the "redirection_uri" element of the Authorization Code Request or the Redirection Endpoint the Third Party provided to the Data Custodian during the registration process.                                                                                                     10. Verify the Third Party ignores the "&gigo=GarbageInGarbageOut" parameter in the Authorization Code Response
Success Criteria: 10.0 Verify the Third Party ignores the "&gigo=GarbageInGarbageOut" parameter in the Authorization Code Response

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Third Party Issues a validly formatted Access Token Request (grant_type=authorization_code)
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Access Token Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                   2. Verify Access Token Request is sent to the Data Custodian's Token Endpoint                                                                                                                                                                                3. Verify the access token request utilizes the BASIC Authentication technique [RFC6749]                                                                                                                      4. Verify all mandatory access token request fields appear in the query component of the access token request using the application/x-www-form-urlencoded format                                                                                                                                            5. Verify the "grant_type" element value is "authorization_code"                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           6. Verify the "client_id" element is NOT present since ESPI is utilizing the HTTP BASIC Authentication technique [RFC2617]                                                                                                                                                                                                                              7. Verify the "redirection_uri" element is present

Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request with an INVALID HTTP BASIC Authorization header
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured

Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian accepts an Access Token Request containing an authorization_code ("code=" parameter) issued to the "client_id" in the Access Token Request
Initial Conditions: Third Party has been authorized (registered) and configured

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request containing an authorization_code ("code=" parameter) NOT issued to the "client_id" in the Access Token Request
Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request containing an INVALID authorization_code ("code=" parameter)
Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request not containing a "redirect_uri" parameter if the original Authorization Request contained a "redirect_uri" parameter

Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request containing a "redirect_uri" parameter if the "redirect_uri" does NOT match the "redirect_uri" parameter contained in the original Authorization Request parameter
Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request containing a "redirect_uri" parameter if the original Authorization Request did NOT contain a "redirect_uri" parameter
Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request containing a previously used authorization_code
Verify Data Custodian rejects an Access Token Request containing an expired authorization_code

Verify Third Party successfully processes a properly formatted Access Token Response

Verify the "grant_type" element is the only element and its value is "client_credentials"

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Third Party successfully processes a properly formatted Access Token Response
Verify Third Party Issues a validly formatted Refresh Token Request
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Refresh Token Request [RFC6749]                                                                                                                   2. Verify Refresh Token Request is sent to the Data Custodian's Token Endpoint                                                                                                                                                                                3. Verify the Refresh Token Request utilizes the BASIC Authentication technique [RFC6749]                                                                                                                      4. Verify the "grant_type" element is the only element and its value is "refresh_token"                                                                                                                  5. Verify the Refresh Token Request contains a "refresh_token" parameter

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request with NO "grant_type" parameter
Initial Conditions: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Access Token Request [RFC6749] without a "code" element                                                                                                            2. Verify the server issues an Access Token Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Refresh Token Request [RFC6749] without a "grant_type" element                                                                                                            2. Verify the server issues an Access Token Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request with NO "refresh_token" parameter
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Refresh Token Request [RFC6749] without a "refresh_code" element                                                                                                            2. Verify the server issues an Access Token Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request with multiple  "grant_type" parameters
Initial Conditions: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Access Token Request [RFC6749] without a "code" element                                                                                                            2. Verify the server issues an Access Token Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Refresh Token Request [RFC6749] with multiple "grant_type" elements                                                                                                            2. Verify the server issues an Access Token Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request with multiple "refresh_token" parameters
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Refresh Token Request [RFC6749] with multiple "refresh_code" elements                                                                                                            2. Verify the server issues an Access Token Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request with multiple "scope" parameters
Test Steps: 1. Client issues an OAuth 2.0 Refresh Token Request [RFC6749] with multiple "scope" elements                                                                                                            2. Verify the server issues an Access Token Request Error Response with an "error" element of "invalid_request"

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify Data Custodian properly authenticates and accepts a Refresh Token Request with a valid HTTP BASIC Authorization header
Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request with a INVALID HTTP BASIC Authorization header
Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request containing a "refresh_token" element that was NOT issued to the requesting Third Party Application
Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request containing a "refresh_token" element that is expired
Verify Data Custodian rejects a Refresh Token Request containing a "scope" element that does NOT match the "scope" element value used to obtain the original Access Token.
Verify implementation of HTTP.
Test Steps:
1.  Log in as an eligible user.
2.  Navigate to web portal Green Button Download My Data screen.
3. Verify that screen is shown
4.  Verify webpage URL utilizes HTTP Protocol  inspect browser for http://.
Success Criteria: Web portal interface utilizes HTTP Protocol.

Test Purpose / Requirement: Verify implementation of HTTPS
Test Steps: For requests that may contain private data, ensure that HTTPS is used, and that HTTP requests are not supported

Test Purpose / Requirement: Test software shall issue a service request over an SSL session and shall verify that the response HTTP header contains the following fields and information  fields TBD
Verify that REST request headers include  fields TBD
Verify that the Data Custodian implements TLS 1.2.
Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer the Data Custodian negotiates the highest level of TLS mutually supported.
Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer the Data Custodian rejects TLS_RSA_WITH_NULL_SHA cipher suites.
Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer at a minimum the Data Custodian accepts the TLS_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA cipher suite.
Verify that when communicating with a Third Party the Data Custodian negotiates the highest level of TLS mutually supported.
Verify that the Data Custodian maintains an unexpired unrevoked RSA certificate with a public key length of at least 2048 bits.

Test software or manual inspection shall verify that the Data Custodian RSA certificate was issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that has been successfully audited according to the criteria of ETSI or WebTrust.

Test software or manual inspection shall verify that Tokens and IDs communicated by the Data Custodian are opaque and if based on actual Customer information that they are randomized using a secure method to protect privacy.
Test software or manual inspection shall verify that Tokens and IDs communicated by the Data Custodian consist of at least 48 bits and can be the random number part of an RFC2422 UUID.
Manual inspection of supporting documentation shall confirm that the Data Custodian implementation utilizes software libraries which are FIPS 140-2 level 1 or higher and listed on the CMVP website.
Verify that the Third Party implements TLS 1.1 or higher.
Verify that when communicating with a Retail Customer the Third Party negotiates the highest level of TLS mutually supported.
Verify that when communicating with a Data Custodian the Third Party negotiates the highest level of TLS mutually supported.
Verify that the Third Party maintains an unexpired unrevoked RSA certificate with a public key length of at least 2048 bits.

Test software or manual inspection shall verify that the Third Party RSA certificate was issued by a Certificate Authority (CA) that has been successfully audited according to the criteria of ETSI or WebTrust.

Test software or manual inspection shall verify that Tokens and IDs communicated by the Third Party are opaque and if based on actual Customer information that they are randomized using a secure method to protect privacy.
Test software or manual inspection shall verify that Tokens and IDs communicated by the Third Party consist of at least 48 bits and can be the random number part of an RFC2422 UUID.
Manual inspection of supporting documentation shall confirm that the Third Party implementation utilizes software libraries which are FIPS 140-2 level 1 or higher and listed on the CMVP website.
